     }
   }
 
+  /**
+   * After startup, datanode needs detect latest leader SCM before handling
+   * any SCMCommand, so that it won't be disturbed by stale leader SCM.
+   *
+   * The rule is: after majority SCMs are in HEARTBEAT state and has
+   * heard from leader SCMs (commandQueue is not empty), datanode will init
+   * termOfLeaderSCM with the max term found in commandQueue.
+   *
+   * The init process also works for non-HA mode. In that case, term of all
+   * SCMCommands will be 0.
+   */
+  void initTermOfLeaderSCM() {

timeline.bodyText: Shall we use AtomicLong for termOfLeaderSCM?
timeline.author: timmylicheng

replies.bodyText:
Good Point.
Since this is executed in a single thread, let's do this first. We surely need to consider the thread safety in future change.
replies.author: GlenGeng

timeline.bodyText:
Any case SCMNodeManager would not require SCMHAManager?
Note that PipelineManager will always rely on SCMHAManager
timeline.author: timmylicheng

replies.bodyText: Quite a lot of unit tests rely on this old Ctor.
replies.author: GlenGeng

timeline.bodyText: I am confused on when termOfLeaderSCM is updated to the newest leader term. Is termOfLeaderSCM updated in during leader selection?
timeline.author: amaliujia

replies.bodyText: Do you mean whether termOfLeaderSCM is updated in leader election of SCM ? No, it won't. Datanode detects the latest SCM term by heartbeat with SCMs, whose interval is larger than 30s.
replies.author: GlenGeng

timeline.bodyText: another challenge is how to test such change. ideally we can have a minicluster setup with configurable nodes so we can simulate the scenario of split brian.

replies.bodyText: Good point. We need add a lot of test cases, including UT and acceptance test, before merging 2823 back to master.

replies.bodyText:
Agreed. I have been thinking about it and we might be some testing infrastructure to simulate these complicated consensus cases. E.g. split-brian.
OM HA might have done something similar.
